Document

cmd-ssg

<img src="https://i.ibb.co/VDZ9LmC/cmd-ssg-img1.png"

alt="Program running -h"

style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;" />

deliverable 0.1 for OSD600 open source course at seneca

Description: command-line-static site tool

VERSION : 0.1.0

Use : Process input .txt or .md files into generated .html files.

FEATURES :

  1. MIT license chosen

  1. Built with Node.js, Commander

  1. running the tool with --version or -v flag will print the tool's name and current version

  1. running the tool with --help or -h flag should print standard help/usage message also showing how to run the tool, which command line flags and arguments can be used, etc.

  1. specify input file or folder with --input or -i

  1. accept .txt and .md files

  1. generate one .html output file for each input file

  1. Use -o or --output to specify output folder else a ./dist folder is used by default

  1. input can be deep within the files such as .\test\test2\

  1. parse a title from your input files

  1. adding -s or --stylesheet stylesheet option

  1. proper error message if incorrect file/folder inputs

  1. Use -c or --config option with json file to pass options from the file

CONTRIBUTING :

See CONTRIBUTING.md for setup and development

Special Thanks : Kevan Yang

Markdown Feature: Oliver Pham

Author : Eugene Chung
